required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors for Predictors of MACEs After RA-CABG
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors for Predictors of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events After Coronary Artery Bypass Using Radial Artery Grafts

brief_summary.textblock:
As the secondary choice of artery grafts, radial artery is more and more used to achieve multiple arterial revascularization in CABG. Risk factors for predictors of major cardiovascular adverse events (MACE) after CABG using radial-artery grafts (RA-CABG), however, remain uncertain. This case-control study aims to identify the baseline predictors of MACE after RA-CABG.
We will collect the baseline characteristics and perioperative data of patients underwent RA-CABG from Jan. 2009 to Dec. 2019 in our single center. By reviewing the latest follow-up records, we will examine the correlation between the baseline characteristics and clinical outcomes (MACEs), then identify the independent risk factors for predictors of MACEs after RA-CABG.

primary_outcome.description: a composite of all-cause death, myocardial infraction, stroke and repeat revascularization
a composite of all-cause death, myocardial infraction, stroke and repeat revascularization
a composite of all-cause death, myocardial infraction, stroke and repeat revascularization
a composite of all-cause death, myocardial infraction, stroke and repeat revascularization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days, 30 days, 1 year, and 3 years post-CABG
secondary_outcome.description: a composite of CV-death, myocardial infraction and stroke

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days, 30 days, 1 year, and 3 years post-CABG
7 days, 30 days, 1 year, and 3 years post-CABG
secondary_outcome.description: Including death resulting from an acute myocardial infarction , sudden cardiac death, death due to heart failure, death due to stroke, death due to cardiovascular procedures, death due to cardiovascular hemorrhage, and death due to other cardiovascular causes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days, 30 days, 1 year, and 3 years post-CABG
secondary_outcome.description: According to the 2017 Cardiovascular and Stroke Endpoint Definitions for Clinical Trials, including CABG-related MI, non CABG-related MI, silent MI and unknown type.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days, 30 days, 1 year, and 3 years post-CABG
secondary_outcome.description: According to the 2017 Cardiovascular and Stroke Endpoint Definitions for Clinical Trials, including ischemic, hemorrhagic and unknown type.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days, 30 days, 1 year, and 3 years post-CABG
secondary_outcome.description: According to the 2017 Cardiovascular and Stroke Endpoint Definitions for Clinical Trials, including any PCI and CABG.

arm_group.description: MACE Group includes the patients suffered from any component of MACE after RA-CABG until the latest follow-up.
Non-MACE Group includes the patients freed from any component of MACE after RA-CABG until the latest follow-up.

study_pop.textblock: Patients 18-year and above underwent RA-CABG from Jan. 2009 to Dec.2019 in one single center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Underwent CABG using at least a radial artery grafts from Jan.2009 to Dec.2019. with or without cardiopulmonary bypass , with or without concomitant procedure
- Aged 18 and above at procedure
- With any gender
Exclusion Criteria:
- With unavailable medical records

facility.name: Ruijin Hospital Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor and Director, Department of Cardiovascular Surgery, Vice President, Ruijin Hospital
